report_title: Budget Hotel Franchises in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 pandemic resulted in a sharp decline in business and leisure travel in 2020. Revenue per available room (RevPAR) and occupancy rates plunged as individuals avoided travel during the height of the pandemic. Over the five years to 2027, the Budget Hotel Franchises industry is expected to increase an annualized 2.6% to $47.2 billion.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The graph shows the employment trend from 2010 to 2028 (projected). Employment grew at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 7.63% from 2010 to 2022, reaching 279,778 units in 2022. From 2022 to 2028, employment is projected to grow at a CAGR of 3.49%.

The graph shows the total wages trend from 2010 to 2028 (projected). Total wages grew at a CAGR of 10.56% from 2010 to 2022, reaching $9,212 million in 2022. From 2022 to 2028, total wages are projected to grow at a CAGR of 3.29%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Domestic Trips by US Residents Trend
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The graph shows the trend in domestic trips by US residents from 2010 to 2028 (projected). Domestic trips grew at a CAGR of 1.98% from 2010 to 2022, reaching 800 million trips in 2022. From 2022 to 2028, domestic trips are projected to grow at a CAGR of 2.88%.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer spending is estimated to increase an annualized 2.5% over the next five years. Moreover, demand from construction, healthcare and logistics workers is anticipated to remain high over the next five years, as increased investment in infrastructure facilitates an anticipated rise in travel for these sectors.

Hotels are anticipated to increasingly use digital technologies to ease workloads and further satisfy each individual guest with a new guest experience. This includes everything from individual food and beverage options and flexible check-in and check-out times to expanded room bandwidth for all traveler segments.

industry_definition: This industry comprises franchise establishments that primarily provide short-term, budget-priced lodging. Reports in our Business Franchise collection focus solely on the operation of franchised outlets and exclude non-franchise data. They show the total number of franchise outlets, total franchise revenue and the average profit earned by franchisees. Our reports also highlight the largest franchisors by market share.
key_trends: Revitalized growth in business travel will likely boost demand
Pent-up demand bolstered leisure travel levels in 2021, and this trend is anticipated to continue in 2022
The industry has proven more resilient to the decline in business travel than hotels which rely on corporate demand
The recent rise of digital nomads and individuals blending business and leisure travel is anticipated to benefit the industry

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages account for 22.2% of industry revenue in 2022.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Many hotel jobs have low skill and training requirements, and employees can be hired on a part-time or casual basis. Due to this practice, many hotels experience high staff turnover.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs account for a large share of industry revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs include the purchasing of bedding and room supplies, such as TVs, chairs and desks. Purchases are anticipated to make up 20.9% of revenue in 2022.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Concentration of technologies is high in this industry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major markets for this industry are highly concentrated
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.
